intro: Spyridium furculentum, commonly known as the mountain spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in elevated regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Spyridium furculentum is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
